p: During 2015–2016, 32.2% (208/645) of the samples tested positive for NoV by both immunochromatography and EIA tests. Of these 208 samples, 95 (45.7%) were successfully genotyped. The GII.17_2014 genotype emerged in the Amazonas state in November 2015 with a total frequency of 12.6% (12/95) with the first positive sample detected in 2015 (1/30, 3.3%) and the others in 2016 (11/65, 16.9%). During this period, GII.Pe/GII.4 was the most frequent genotype (50.5%, 48/95), followed by GII.16/GII.4 (16.9%, 16/95) (Fig. 1). Other genotypes, such as GII.P7/GII.6, GII.P16/GII.30, GII.P7/GII.7, GII.Pg/GII.1, and GII.P21/GII.13 (20%, 19/95) were also detected.
